title: Python Basics
content: Python is an interpreted, high-level programming language.

title: Machine Learning
content: Machine learning allows systems to learn from data without being explicitly programmed.

title: Data Science
content: Data science combines domain expertise, programming skills, and knowledge of mathematics and statistics.

title: Neural Networks
content: Neural networks are a subset of machine learning, inspired by the structure of the human brain.

title: Deep Learning
content: Deep learning uses neural networks with many layers.

title: Natural Language Processing
content: NLP enables computers to understand human language.

title: Computer Vision
content: Computer vision involves teaching machines to interpret and understand visual information.

title: Big Data
content: Big data refers to extremely large data sets that may be analyzed computationally.

title: Reinforcement Learning
content: Reinforcement learning is a feedback-based machine learning method.

title: Support Vector Machines
content: SVMs are supervised learning models for classification and regression.

title: Decision Trees
content: Decision trees are used for classification and regression tasks.

title: Random Forest
content: Random forests are ensembles of decision trees.

title: K-Means Clustering
content: K-Means is an unsupervised algorithm used for clustering.

title: Pandas Library
content: Pandas is a Python library used for data manipulation and analysis.

title: NumPy Library
content: NumPy is used for working with arrays and numerical data.

title: Matplotlib
content: Matplotlib is a plotting library for Python.

title: Scikit-Learn
content: Scikit-learn is a machine learning library in Python.

title: TensorFlow
content: TensorFlow is an open-source library for machine learning and deep learning.

title: PyTorch
content: PyTorch is a popular open-source machine learning library.

title: Transfer Learning
content: Transfer learning is a technique where a model trained on one task is used for another.

title: Dimensionality Reduction
content: Techniques like PCA help reduce the number of input variables.

title: Principal Component Analysis
content: PCA is used to reduce dimensionality of datasets.

title: Gradient Descent
content: Gradient descent is an optimization algorithm used to minimize loss.

title: Overfitting and Underfitting
content: These are key challenges in machine learning model training.

title: Cross Validation
content: Cross-validation is a technique for assessing model performance.

title: Hyperparameter Tuning
content: Tuning hyperparameters is essential for model optimization.

title: Feature Engineering
content: Feature engineering involves creating new input features.

title: Feature Selection
content: Feature selection reduces the number of input variables to those that are most useful.

title: Model Evaluation Metrics
content: Metrics like accuracy, precision, recall are used to evaluate models.

title: Logistic Regression
content: Logistic regression is used for binary classification tasks.

title: Linear Regression
content: Linear regression is used for predicting a continuous value.

title: Bayesian Networks
content: Bayesian networks are graphical models that represent probabilistic relationships.

title: Markov Chains
content: Markov chains model stochastic processes with memoryless transitions.

title: Information Retrieval
content: IR deals with obtaining relevant information from large collections.

title: Vector Space Model
content: In VSM, documents and queries are represented as vectors.

title: TF-IDF
content: TF-IDF is used to evaluate the importance of a word in a document.

title: Cosine Similarity
content: Cosine similarity measures similarity between two vectors.

title: Jaccard Similarity
content: Jaccard index measures similarity between finite sets.

title: Lucene Search
content: Lucene is a text search engine library.

title: Elasticsearch
content: Elasticsearch is a distributed search and analytics engine.

title: BM25 Ranking
content: BM25 is a ranking function for IR based on probabilistic retrieval.

title: Question Answering
content: QA systems return answers to questions posed in natural language.

title: Conversational AI
content: Conversational AI simulates human-like dialogue.

title: Chatbots
content: Chatbots are AI agents designed for interaction with users.

title: Search Engine Indexing
content: Indexing improves speed and efficiency of search queries.

title: Web Crawling
content: Web crawlers automatically browse and download web content.

title: Knowledge Graphs
content: Knowledge graphs store relationships between entities.

title: Named Entity Recognition
content: NER identifies proper names in text such as people, places, and organizations.

title: Relation Extraction
content: Relation extraction finds relationships between entities in text.

title: Text Summarization
content: Summarization condenses text into a shorter version retaining key information.
